UNhB8WNTTENg6ChW.name: Find Steed
UNhB8WNTTENg6ChW.description:
You summon a spirit that takes the form of a loyal mount, creating a lasting bond with it. You decide on the steed's appearance, and choose whether it uses the statistics of an elk, giant lizard, panther, warhorse, or wolf (the Narrator may offer additional options.) Its statistics change in the following ways:

  • Its type is your choice of celestial, fey, or fiend.
  • Its size is your choice of Medium or Large.
  • Its Intelligence is 6.
  • You can communicate with it telepathically while it's within 1 mile.
  • It understands one language that you speak.

While mounted on your steed, when you cast a spell that targets only yourself, you may also target the steed.

When you use an action to dismiss the steed, or when it drops to 0 hit points, it temporarily disappears. Casting this spell again resummons the steed, fully healed and with all conditions removed. You can't summon a different steed unless you spend an action to release your current steed from its bond, permanently dismissing it.

Cast at Higher Levels. The steed has an additional 20 hit points for each slot level above 2nd. When using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, you may grant the steed either a swim speed or fly speed equal to its base Speed.

system.description: At 14th level, you gain the services of a draconic mount, either an ally you have bonded, a gift from your master, or a creature you have broken and bound to you. You may cast the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.oqsv50k3glkbk7z2]{Find Steed} spell at 5th level without expending spell points once per long rest. The steed you summon always has the stats of a giant lizard with the following changes: it is large, has an AC of 18, it is immune to your draconic damage type, you must choose to give it a fly speed instead of a swim speed, its type is dragon, it uses your spell attack bonus for any attacks it makes, and it gains a breath weapon action. This breath weapon is a 30 foot cone and deals 5d6 damage your draconic damage type on a failure or half damage on a success, uses your warlock spell save DC, and can only be used once per short or long rest.
